position.marginalia_text: & bene coaptetis consanguineu[m] consanguineis, & primu[m] sono [etc]

marginalia.translation: And relationships well joined together through a blood line, and first through sound.

position.marginalia_text: Item Notetis quod Argentum nostru[m], Calcinatio, Incineratio, Mela[n]cholia, Nigredo, Nox, Putrefactio, Pra[e]gnatio, & Sputum idem significant. Sed quid remanet corruptu[m] post putrefactione[m]? Respondemus, Substantia forma[e], qua[e] ante putrefactione[m] erat in potentia rei, introducta ex proportione Elementoru[m]

marginalia.translation: Also note what our quicksilver, calcination, incineration, melancholy, blackness, night, putrefaction, universal fertility and spittle also signify. But whay remains corupted after the putrefaction? We will respond: the substance of the form, which before the putrefaction was in the potential of the thing, introduced from the proportion of elements [...].
